alert.note: Alert for Central Greenville; Southern Greenville (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 07 at 5:42AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WITH TORRENTIAL RAINFALL WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL GREENVILLE AND WESTERN SPARTANBURG COUNTIES UNTIL 645 AM EDT... At 537 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a series of showers and thunderstorms moving northeast at 5 mph along the Interstate 85 corridor and across the greater Greer, SC area. These showers and thunderstorms were producing rainfall at rates of one to two inches per hour. Locations to be impacted include... Spartanburg, Greenville Downtown, Greer, Taylors, Five Forks, Duncan, Lyman, Wellford, Inman and Roebuck. The heavy rainfall rates will lead to deep ponding of water in poor drainage spots on area roadways.
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters.
